content.description: Start on 'Grommit', left of 'Seven Spanish Angels' and traverse right to finish on 'Seven Spanish Angels'... great!

Stand start with a left hand in a good/sharp crack slot, right hand in the other crack system. Make a couple moves to more sharp crimps, sidepulls, and/or slopers. Top out left on good holds.

Probably easier for taller folks, could be harder for the short.

climbs.name: To Kill Ya Corner Sit Start

content.description: Sit start on a pinch / jug and climb rightwards finishing on To Kill Ya Corner.
Start high on the triangular block.  Press out a technical high-step with a crimp to reach the large positive edge.  Finish on jugs up high.
content.location: Just right of the northeast arete.  Look for the obvious jug/flake start.

content.description: Sit start matched on a very low hold and climb into Seven Spanish Angels.

climbs.name: The Ruckus (aka Seven Spanish Angels)
climbs.fa: Jason Jackson (December 1, 1999) named it "The Ruckus".  Greg Haverstock also claimed the FA (date unknown) and named it "Seven Spanish Angels."

content.description: A must do!  One of the best in Bishop.  Climb the knobs and dyno for the tea-cup hueco at the lip.

For the most bang for your buck start this one sitting on the left side of the scooped out feature. Tall and with some chewy rock for higher entertainment up high.

Start pinching the edge of the scoop feature and move up to the patina flakes. Move up and right along the edge of the scoop getting higher until you can step over the roof/scoop and follow the sometimes disintegrating flakes up along the seam to the top.
content.location: On the most obvious patina face as you approach the boulder along the road, not truly facing the road. The problem follows the seam that starts from the upper left side of a large scoop.

content.description: A superb sloper arete climb. Sit start on the leftside of the angled arete with a couple good footholds and hands on the arete. Climb the arete rightwards using heel hooks and smears until you get your hands on a small seam. There is a small good cobble/ feature a little higher from the seam. Grab it and mantel over. Finish up the slab to the top of the boulder and take a deep breath of fresh airband enjoy the view!
content.location: This climb is located uphill from the Get Carter Boulder on the arete facing the road. It can be seen from Get Carter and is only a minute walk.

content.description: Sit start with your right hand in the crack and left on the dogbone pinch (same as for A Scanner Darkly), climb up and finish Michael Caine.
Start standing with the left hand on a high gaston in the right-hand seam.  Pull on and make a long shouldery move right to join with the top of 'Get Carter'.

Sustained, technical sidepulling along a continuous feature with a high crux makes this one of the best of its grade at the Milks. Follow the right-trending weakness to a hard move reaching out right and shooting to the lip.
content.protection: The landing is pretty nasty - a big slabby rock whose edge sits right where a climber is likely to fall. I peeled off and badly sprained my foot (one foot onto the pad, the other toe-first into the pea gravel!) Cuidado.
content.location: Just to the left of the popular blobs of Seven Spanish Angels. Downclimb the opposite side of the boulder.

content.description:
A much traveled classic.

Sit-start and slap up slopers following the striking black streak on the north-west side of the boulder.

Requires compression and core strength for the grade.

climbs.name: Flecheros
climbs.fa: Jake Whittaker and Dimitri Barton, early 2000s

content.description: Slightly less obvious but really cool. Start on To Kill Ya Corner Sit and climb straight up, using a small nubbly for the left and perhaps a large loaf pinch for the right. Make your way up and slightly left with good technique, way up to the top. Dimitri and I did this thing on an amazing sunny and snowy day. After poodling off the top numerous times we dragged the mattress out of my van, hit the stainless bong a few times, and both floated to the top through rainbow snow flurries. Dimitri later lapped this thing in his Huarache sandals. It’s all technique!
content.location: Right of blunt arete between Ruckus and To Kill Ya Corner...tallest part of boulder.

content.description: Sit start on the pinch/jug (same as To Ya Kill Corner Sit) and traverse left finishing on Seven Spanish Angels.
Arete to the right of Backside Crack.
Fun way to the top. Also the downclimb.
content.protection: Two pads, kinda highball but good landing.
content.location: Roadside of the Get Carter boulder.

content.description: Start as for Michael Caine Sit (right hand on good sidepull and left on dog bone) and climb up and right into the finish of Get Carter.

Sit start with your right hand in the crack and your left on the dogbone pinch. Throw left hand up and make a tricky foot swap. From here make a wild throw with the right hand to a sloping edge (crux) and continue up the two cracks and finish as for Twin Cracks. A very hard sustained line that is sure to be a classic. A must do if you climb the grade.
content.protection: Bring pads and tape this thing is pretty sharp.
content.location: This is the sit start to Twin Cracks
